All this in 1 pot.', 'ingredients': [{'name': 'pork loin roast', 'quantity': '1 (2 1/2 pound)', 'measurement': '', 'preparation': 'rolled and tied'}, {'name': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'measurement': 'teaspoon', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'black pepper', 'quantity': '1/2', 'measurement': 'teaspoon', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'vegetable oil', 'quantity': '2', 'measurement': 'tablespoons', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'butter', 'quantity': '2', 'measurement': 'tablespoons', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'whole milk', 'quantity': '3', 'measurement': 'cups', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'rosemary', 'quantity': '1', 'measurement': 'teaspoon', 'preparation': 'chopped fresh '}, {'name': 'garlic', 'quantity': '1', 'measurement': 'clove', 'preparation': 'minced'}, {'name': 'water', 'quantity': '3', 'measurement': 'tablespoons', 'preparation': ''}], 'directions': ['Season pork loin with salt and pepper. Remove pork and set aside to rest.', 'If the milk is not already a nutty brown color, increase the heat until the milk beings to brown. Spoon off any additional fat. Slice the pork and serve with the milk sauce.'], 'nutrition_facts': 'Nutrition Facts\nPer Serving:\n313 calories;\n20.7 g fat;\n4.4 g carbohydrates;\n25.9 g protein;\n84 mg cholesterol;\n388 mg sodium.\nPowered by the ESHA Research Database © 2018, ESHA Research, Inc. {'name': 'Mistakenly Zesty Pork Chops', 'description': 'Yes, the title says it all! This recipe was created by mistake. {'name': 'Pork Roast and Sauerkraut', 'description': "My family which is mostly German-Irish ate the same meal for New Year's every year of my life. Pigs push forward, rooting themselves in the ground before moving, and we need to move into the New Year in the same way. We eat sauerkraut, as it's believed it will bring blessings and wealth for the new year. It also reminds us that with the good comes the bitter as well. Once cooked down, transfer this to the roasting pan.', 'Heat the remaining olive oil in the same skillet over medium high heat. Place the pork loin in the heated oil and brown well on all sides. Set the roast on top of all the vegetables in the roasting pan. Add the beer and molasses to the skillet and bring to a boil, scraping up all the browned bits on the bottom of the skillet. Pour this and the broth over the pork roast and vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes. Turn pork over and bake until the internal temperature of the pork reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). At this point, remove the pan from the oven and let the pork sit on a cutting board for 5 minutes. Then slice the pork into serving size pieces. Discard the bay leaves. Return the sliced pork to the pan resting over the vegetables. {'name': 'Bacon and Potato Frittata with Greens', 'description': 'This is a wonderful meal anytime of day or night. My grandfather used to make frittatas quite often. Instead of finishing a frittata under the broiler he would cook it halfway, put a plate on top of the pan, flip the pan over, and slide the frittata back into the pan to cook the other side. Sometimes a frittata would stick; other times the hot oil would drip on him as he performed this maneuver. Remove pan from heat and cool pancetta in the oil in the skillet.', 'Place 1 dough quarter on a work surface and lightly dust with flour; roll into a 1/8-inch-thick irregularly shaped crust. Stretch dough with your hands to an even thickness; let rest on the work surface for 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining dough.', 'Heat about 1 cup olive oil, reaching about 1/2-inch depth, in a heavy cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Drain the crusts on paper towels.', 'Transfer pizza crusts, lighter-side up, to prepared baking sheets. Spread about 2 tablespoons ricotta cheese onto each crust using the back of a spoon. Sprinkle about 1/2 teaspoon fresh thyme over ricotta layer. Sprinkle pancetta over the ricotta-thyme layer; season with black pepper. Nestle about 5 peach slices onto each pizza, working around the pancetta pieces. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon Parmesan-Reggiano cheese over each pizza. Drizzle about 1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil over Parmesan-Reggiano layer.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and peaches are lightly browned and tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Cool pizzas for 5 to 10 minutes on the baking sheet.'], 'nutrition_facts': 'Nutrition Facts\nPer Serving:\n504 calories;\n25.8 g fat;\n46.3 g carbohydrates;\n19.8 g protein;\n34 mg cholesterol;\n1098 mg sodium.\nPowered by the ESHA Research Database © 2018, ESHA Research, Inc. This recipe was created from two existing recipes, with the idea courtesy of the St. Louis Post Dispatch.', 'ingredients': [{'name': 'cooking spray', 'quantity': '', 'measurement': '', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'bacon', 'quantity': '1 (12 ounce)', 'measurement': 'package', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'margarine', 'quantity': '1/2', 'measurement': 'cup', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'dark brown sugar', 'quantity': '3/4', 'measurement': 'cup', 'preparation': 'packed '}, {'name': 'maple syrup', 'quantity': '1/2', 'measurement': 'cup', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '3/4', 'measurement': 'cup', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'ground cinnamon', 'quantity': '2', 'measurement': 'teaspoons', 'preparation': ''}, {'name': 'refrigerated biscuit dough', 'quantity': '2 (16.3 ounce)', 'measurement': 'packages', 'preparation': 'separated and cut into quarters'}], 'directions': ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the inside of a 9-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt(R)) with cooking spray.', 'Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain the bacon slices on paper towels; crumble and remove extra fat.', 'Melt margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat; stir in brown sugar and maple syrup. Bring mixture to a boil; cook and stir until mixture begins to foam, about 1 minute. Remove saucepan from heat.', 'Mix white sugar and cinnamon in a resealable plastic bag; add 6 to 8 biscuit pieces at a time and shake until well coated. Place saucepan over medium heat and cook and stir until sugar dissolves, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Sprinkle 1/4 the bacon pieces in the bottom of the tube pan; pour in about 1/4 the brown sugar mixture.
